snippet: If aggressive efforts to deny Mr. Trump the presidential nomination fail, the party leaders say they will try to field an independent candidate for the general election.
abstract: Republican leaders, facing increasingly desperate odds, are honing strategy to block Donald Trump from receiving 2016 presidential nomination; plan includes 100-day smear campaign beginning at Wisconsin primary in April and backup plan to field independent candidate.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and JONATHAN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: If aggressive efforts to deny Mr. Trump the presidential nomination fail, the party leaders say they will try to field an independent candidate for the general election.

headline.main: Republican Leaders Map a Strategy to Derail Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Facing Long Odds, G.O.P. Leaders Map Strategy to Derail Trump
